thread.title: The Russian president raised valid questions for Americans
thread.title_full: The Russian president raised valid questions for Americans - The Washington Post

author: washingtonpost.com
title: The Russian president raised valid questions for Americans
text:
President Barack Obama and Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday at the United Nations. (Andrew Harnik/Associated Press) October 2 at 6:12 PM The Sept. 29 front-page article “ Obama, Putin clash over Syria crisis ” highlighted key questions that should have been debated and resolved by Congress long ago. The complexity of opposing Middle East factions, fluid alliances and underlying issues is largely lost on the American people. The lack of debate on Capitol Hill and the simplistic overuse of the label “terrorism” by the media contribute to this lack of understanding.
Ironically, Russian President Vladimir Putin’s points regarding attempts by Western nations to impose democracy resulting in “violence and social disaster,” whether intervention in Syria violates international law and what a stable Syrian end state would look like should already have been weighed by Congress, the president and the American people. Who would have thought that Mr. Putin, of all people, would serve as the catalyst for long-avoided democratic principles?
Dan Edwards , Woodbridge
